description: From Latin Penātēs, from penus (“inner part of house”).

entries.meaning: (Roman mythology) The household deities thought to watch over the houses and storerooms of ancient Rome.
examples: lest the name thereof being discovered unto their enemies, their Penates and Patronal Gods might be called forth by charms and incantations.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Synonym of household deities in other contexts.
